<!--

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1111 
- Added layouts for `Onboarding` screens for `Tablet` devices in `Portrait` mode **(Low-fi )**
- Mocks Link: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/d8d62875-05ab-46a7-8f2f-a0db58826d5b/P-Onboarding-1
## Checklist

- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1084
- Added layouts for `Onboarding` screens for `Tablet` devices in `Landscape` mode (**High-fi**  )
- Mock link: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/
## Screenshots
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 04 434](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326244-a2d41180-a272-11ea-8465-5833162c29d4.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 12 047](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326246-a798c580-a272-11ea-9cea-eed445568dfa.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 17 295](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326247-abc4e300-a272-11ea-946e-aa85bc344a97.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 23 743](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326248-aebfd380-a272-11ea-85bd-0a2228cdfdc3.png)

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->

[{'comment_id': 429516184, 'comment_body': 'Remove this file and use the existing `onboarding_dot_active`.
We normally round up the dimensions to nearest dimension `4dp` and as it is `5px` in mocks we can use `4dp` here.

All dimensions should be in multiple of `4dp`. (There are some exceptions like border strokes)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 5, 26, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429516315, 'comment_body': 'The parent of this viewgroup which is `FrameLayout` is actually doing nothing for these mocks, so you can remove that `FrameLayout` and use `ConstraintLayout` directly here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 5, 28, 44, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429516386, 'comment_body': 'Color code for `onboarding_fragment_divider_view ` is `#707070` in the mocks and you are using `#333333` which is incorrect.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 5, 30, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429516631, 'comment_body': 'Remove this padding start and padding end.

Instead you have to use `marginStart = 12dp` and `marginEnd = 12dp`

Also, just an explanation of how you can easily cross-verify out these things

The bottom bar layout height is `72dp` in mocks.
The height of image button arrow is `48dp`
The margin top for arrow is `12dp`as per mocks
The margin bottom for arrow is `12dp` as per mocks

72dp = 48dp + 12dp + 12dp', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 5, 35, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429517342, 'comment_body': 'As per mocks the dimension of image is `640x624`  (39:40 ratio)
And as per image file in drawable the dimensions are `320x360` (9:8 ratio)

So either the mocks should be updated to us a ratio of `9:8` (Maybe use 555 px width of image `555 = 624*8/9`)


Or we should have image which has dimension of `640x624` which can be used for tablet layouts.

@mschanteltc PTAL', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 5, 47, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429517432, 'comment_body': "Please don't use guidlines, as for the way we have prepared mocks, it does not guarantee the at a fix percentage the text will start or end. Avoid using guidlines in such cases and instead rely on margin/padding as they provide more robust solution and can work across devices.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 5, 49, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429556222, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 15, 39, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429556230, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 15, 39, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429556236, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 15, 39, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429556243, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 15, 39, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 429556275, 'comment_body': "But if I'm going to remove the `guidlines`, I'll have to use some fixed widths.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 23, 15, 40, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430213706, 'comment_body': 'Why do we need fixed width if we remove guidelines? I mean, we have done in mobile screens without guidelines and it works fine in HDPI + Screens.

Can you please explain how will it affect the UI if we do not use guidelines and fixed width and instead simply use margins/paddings.
', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 7, 38, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430646780, 'comment_body': "I mean that if we didn't use guidelines nor fixed widths, we'll have some options here:  
1. Make a constraint between the `TextView` and the `Thumbnail` and between the `TextView` and the `Parent` then set the width of the `TextView` to `match_constraint` (0dp) and use the suitable margins
2. Make only 1 constraint between the `TextView` and the `Parent` and use the suitable margins and make the width of the `TextView` to `wrap_content`
And in both options, the text in each `TextView` will be only in one line, but in the mocks we have multiple lines.  
So, to have multiple lines like the mocks, I think we'll have to use either guidlines or fixed widths", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 19, 14, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430708210, 'comment_body': 'The images in the mocks start from the top of the screen and end above the navbar. This means that some of the image is below the sysbar and the page navigation bar (Skip, Page Indicators, Right Arrow). Would it be possible that we can overlap these or would a cropped image work better? ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 26, 21, 7, 15, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mschanteltc', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430836562, 'comment_body': '@mschanteltc Cropped version would actually work better here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 27, 3, 25, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 430837359, 'comment_body': 'Okay, then in that case we will need the guidelines. Lets get the images from Chantel and then update this accordingly.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 27, 3, 28, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432295053, 'comment_body': '@mschanteltc Can you please provide these images? Cropped images.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 29, 7, 8, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432791831, 'comment_body': 'Created a new [image folder](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1ph16B-BPOvixkuL31hI6cIB8F0HSEx6Y?usp=sharing) with updated images to be cropped. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 30, 0, 34, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'mschanteltc', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432921035, 'comment_body': 'Keep this. This ratio makes sure that image is always visible in best way.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 31, 7, 59, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432921076, 'comment_body': 'Ditto as above.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 31, 8, 0, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432921141, 'comment_body': 'EOF is missing, add one blank line at the end.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 31, 8, 1, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432921149, 'comment_body': 'EOF is missing, add one blank line at the end.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 5, 31, 8, 1, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 432927464, 'comment_body': 'After following this approach -and setting the width to 0dp-, the thumbnails appeared horizontally compressed.  
## After using 
```
app:layout_constraintDimensionRatio="H, 10:9"
```
![screenshot-2020-05-31_11 12 41 093](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83348801-0c662580-a330-11ea-8eda-1654f5cccb60.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-31_11 12 55 522](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83348825-3ddef100-a330-11ea-896a-20b560c9035c.png)
## Before using
```
app:layout_constraintDimensionRatio="H, 10:9"
```
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 12 047](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83348805-11c37000-a330-11ea-811a-e8ae372eb711.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 23 743](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83348841-4e8f6700-a330-11ea-9e14-4e934444194e.png)

And it is obvious that sticking with the approach that doesn't use `app:layout_constraintDimensionRatio="H, 10:9"` will give us a better result as it looks exactly the same as the [mocks](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/00a93a92-aa03-42d4-9a98-d186eaeec2ca/L-Onboarding-4). But using `app:layout_constraintDimensionRatio="H, 10:9"` will make the images a bit compressed.  
The first approach will always look better as it uses `android:layout_height="0dp"` so that the image will always fill the screen vertically, and `android:layout_width="wrap_content"` which will make the image take whatever width it needs, this will make the image appear with the correct ratio because the image file itself is in the correct ratio. Finally, `android:scaleType="fitXY"` ensures that the image is in the right place.
@rt4914 PTAL

pr_title: Fixes #1084: Tablet: Highfi Onboarding Flow (landscape) (merged with ktlint_upgrade)
pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->
## Note
This PR is the same as [PR #1115](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/pull/1115) but merged with [kt_lint branch](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/pull/1242)
## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1084
- Added layouts for `Onboarding` screens for `Tablet` devices in `Landscape` mode (**High-fi**  )
- Mock link: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/
## Screenshots
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 04 434](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326244-a2d41180-a272-11ea-8465-5833162c29d4.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 12 047](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326246-a798c580-a272-11ea-9cea-eed445568dfa.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 17 295](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326247-abc4e300-a272-11ea-946e-aa85bc344a97.png)
![screenshot-2020-05-30_12 37 23 743](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/83326248-aebfd380-a272-11ea-85bd-0a2228cdfdc3.png)

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1188 
- Fixes #1190 
- Implemented low-fi UI for both landscape and portrait mode in **ProfileChooser-FirstTime** tablet
- Mocks: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/33741ea7-89da-4e5d-b2a4-9872f6db48b4/L-Profile-Chooser-First-Time

## Notes
- I had to use `closeSoftKeyboard()` in two test cases because the `BackButton` closes the soft keyboard instead of performing what it is expected to perform, so I had to close the soft keyboard first then perform `pressBack()`
- I had to add a check for the type of the device _(Tablet or normal device)_ because the behavior is different in each case.

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->
## Important note
This PR violates the outer margins in the mocks, it uses 96dp as outer margins instead of 152dp. I have done that because we were having a problem implementing the 152dp outer margins in the HomeFragment. For more information about the problem, PTAL [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Q0T-2zUfW7soyZLZL7yNfMi-pGkFd1pXAFVBsqeOxuI/edit#).  
The solution was to use 96dp instead and @mschanteltc -the UI/UX designer- and @rt4914  approved that solution, that happened in PR #1331    
So, I have applied this solution here too.  
@mschanteltc please check the screenshots below and tell me if there is something that I need to change, Thanks.
## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Implemented high-fi tablet UI for RecentlyPlayed landscape mode
- Fixes #1145 
- Mock link: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/17910ab6-21f3-4c85-9429-bea2da2b3c26/L-Recently-Played-Stories

pr_title: Fixes #1366: Fix bottom paddings in scrollable screens (Tablet)
pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1366 
- Updates all the bottom paddings in Home, ProfileChooser, and RecentlyPlayed.
### Note
In the case of `home_fragment.xml` the bottom padding is 100dp only. This is because in the `TopicListAdapter` the last item in the screen has a padding of 12dp. So, the total bottom padding will be 100 + 12 = 112 which is the required value .
## Checklist

pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 443409407, 'comment_body': 'This should be `private var spanCount = 0` and create a setter function to update this value.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 8, 50, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443409776, 'comment_body': '`/* right= */ 0`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 8, 51, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443409944, 'comment_body': '`/* left= */ 0`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 8, 51, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443418936, 'comment_body': 'From what I know, Kotlin internally creates a setter and a getter and uses them. If you create a Java class and tried to access the `spanCount`, you will only be able to access it using its getter `getSpanCount()` which had been generated automatically.  \r\nPTAL [here](https://www.programiz.com/kotlin-programming/getters-setters)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 9, 7, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443424188, 'comment_body': '@MohamedMedhat1998 Yeah that is correct but we should avoid making variables public to other files as much as possible and thats why the separate setter function will make things precise.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 9, 16, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443425907, 'comment_body': "Ok, I'll fix that", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 9, 19, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443431028, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 9, 28, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443431075, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 9, 28, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 443431106, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 6, 22, 9, 28, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}]

- Refactored `ProfileChooserFragmentPresenter` code by removing the boilerplate `if` statements that check the type of the device and replacing them with XML values overridden in different configurations.  
- Fixes #1367

[{'comment_id': 454184054, 'comment_body': 'This animation has no role in expand/collapse of the list and can be used independently anywhere.
Therefore rename this to:
`app:rotationAnimation`

Also, pass change the `isExpanded` to `isClockwise` which can be used to control clockwise/anticlockwise rotation.
Also, If possible pass angle in the function so that it because completely reusable at different places.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 14, 8, 15, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461641974, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 14, 48, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461718418, 'comment_body': 'This attribute does not make sense to me, why do we need this?
Because if we are passing both `app:isRotationClockwise ` and `app:rotationAngle ` then it will work or else not.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 16, 35, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 461730687, 'comment_body': 'updated', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 28, 16, 55, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}]

<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes part of #1161 
- Implemented high-fi UI for **Topic-Lessons** for portrait mode - tablet
- Mocks: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/a98b7a3c-46c4-49c6-af77-14a1ff5b7b03/
## Screenshots
### MDPI Emulator (1024x768)
![screenshot-2020-07-15_10 47 39 623](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/87525188-712fd200-c689-11ea-8ace-f0a2a404ae61.png)

![screenshot-2020-07-15_10 47 45 782](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/87525190-7260ff00-c689-11ea-8a8c-a739305f2258.png)

### XHDPI Emulator (2560x1800)
![screenshot-2020-07-15_10 44 53 117](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/87525211-79880d00-c689-11ea-8ccd-e98f7426f47c.png)

![screenshot-2020-07-15_10 44 58 743](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/87525216-7ab93a00-c689-11ea-9ae1-63dcc04499d7.png)

## Notes
- The `TabLayout` will be updated in another PR
- I used a fixed width for the items of the recycler view based on the discussion with Chantel
- I have wrapped each item of the recycler view with a `FrameLayout` to center them. I could have changed the width of the recycler view itself but that will make it scrollable only from the center, which I think is a bad behavior
## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1493
- Implemented the split-screen for the Question and Exploration Player
- Mocks: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/72484161-8707-438a-bf20-50f964216d76/
- `ImageClickInput` test cases issue #1512 
## Screenshots
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 17 09 576](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173192-76a99100-cc22-11ea-96d3-95365127ee84.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 17 28 166](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173210-7c9f7200-cc22-11ea-8e26-b7f7e9440f6a.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 18 10 713](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173227-83c68000-cc22-11ea-92ef-02d1ca91bded.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 18 46 641](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173254-8e811500-cc22-11ea-9afd-fb8b313e098e.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 19 27 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173272-9476f600-cc22-11ea-953b-9ebe2bc51a15.png)

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 22, 19, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459759730, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 22, 19, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459759836, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 22, 19, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459759881, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 22, 19, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459800617, 'comment_body': 'Should we be using directional terminology (left/right)? How should this split column work for RTL layouts? Perhaps instead, we have primary & secondary item lists, or conversation item list & extra interaction item list. What do you think?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 35, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459800798, 'comment_body': 'Is ``if (isSplitView.get()) {`` not sufficient?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 36, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801131, 'comment_body': 'Since the unit is in inches, the method name should compute that, e.g.: ``computeDeviceDiagonalSizeInches``', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 37, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801254, 'comment_body': "Perhaps instead: ``shouldSplitScreen``? I'm assuming it's always 'possible', just not always desirable.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 38, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801751, 'comment_body': 'Can we centrally define this property, instead? E.g. either as part of the service-level interaction module, or as part of the interaction view model module. We have two modules that define all things interactions, and we should incorporate this in one of those locations to make it easier to add & tweak interaction support in the future. I suggest adding this to the UI module for defining interaction view models, if possible: https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/blob/develop/app/src/main/java/org/oppia/app/player/state/itemviewmodel/InteractionViewModelModule.kt.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 40, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801857, 'comment_body': "Or: ``isDeviceLargeEnoughForSplitScreen`` might be more explicitly clear. 'is splittable' almost reads like whether the device supports [split screen/multi-window](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/multi-window), which isn't the case here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 40, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802152, 'comment_body': 'This provider is unnecessary--``SplitScreenManager`` is already injectable, so its type is automatically bound.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 42, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802226, 'comment_body': 'Perhaps: ``extra_interaction_recycler_view``?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 42, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802453, 'comment_body': '``shouldSplitInteractions`` might be clearer. Otherwise this is pretty vague for being in a centralized location like this. Also, isn't this more like "shouldCheckForSplittingInteraction" since the actual decision to do so depends on other factors (e.g. interaction ID & physical device size)?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 43, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802824, 'comment_body': 'Why do we need tablet & non-tablet landscape layouts for state & question players? It seems like standard landscape is also set up for split screen. Is this meant to fix margins & padding? If so, can we do that via dimens files rather than forking the whole layout?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 45, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459803149, 'comment_body': 'Is this correct? Do we want the previous button to be added to the right list?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 46, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459803501, 'comment_body': 'There seems to be a lot of logical forks here. Can we maybe split this into a few different helpers to make it a bit easier to understand what is being setup when for each case?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 48, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459803886, 'comment_body': 'Can this fit on one line? If so, prefer to. Also, I think we can simplify this slightly: ```kotlin if (playerFeatureSet.interactionSupport) { val interactionItemList = if (isSplitView) rightPendingItemList else leftPendingItemList addInteractionForPendingState(interactionItemList, interaction, hasPreviousState, gcsEntityId) } ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 49, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459922985, 'comment_body': 'I'd go with "conversation item list & extra interaction item list" This is a screenshot from an RTL emulator ![screenshot-2020-07-24_10 32 46 199](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88374074-636d0180-cd99-11ea-8150-e250267c2446.png) And using left/right for naming the lists isn't accurate, so I'll change them to " conversation item list & extra interaction item list"', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 8, 36, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459925717, 'comment_body': "It is complaining when I do it this way because `isSplitView.get()` is nullable (Boolean?) So I have done it this way. I'm not sure whether using `isSplitView.get()!!` will be suitable here or it may cause the app to crash.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 8, 42, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459927059, 'comment_body': 'You have different views then 😄 @rt4914 @BenHenning You can decide together what I should do. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 8, 45, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459937917, 'comment_body': '`shouldCheckForSplittingInteraction` is better in my opinion.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 8, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459941861, 'comment_body': "Because there will be some tablets that won't support the split-screen. For these devices, we have some mocks [here](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/ff2d65ea-38d0-4ce9-a28d-183a03e1b061/). >Is this meant to fix margins & padding? If so, can we do that via dimens files rather than forking the whole layout? Yes, this is meant to fix margins & padding. But I think creating different files for tablet devices will make them easier to develop than using a lot of values in `dimens.xml` for different margins - padding.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 15, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459944034, 'comment_body': "It isn't being added to the right list (`extraInteractionPendingItemList`) here, it is being added to the left one (`conversationPendingItemList`). ``` extraInteractionPendingItemList += SubmitButtonViewModel( canSubmitAnswer, /* hasPreviousButton= */ false, previousNavigationButtonListener, fragment as SubmitNavigationButtonListener ) if (hasPreviousButton) { conversationPendingItemList += PreviousButtonViewModel( previousNavigationButtonListener ) } ```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 20, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459953960, 'comment_body': '>Can this fit on one line? If so, prefer to. It will fail in lint checks (Exceeded max line length) >if (playerFeatureSet.interactionSupport) { val interactionItemList = if (isSplitView) rightPendingItemList else leftPendingItemList addInteractionForPendingState(interactionItemList, interaction, hasPreviousState, gcsEntityId) } Yes, this is better', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 42, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459961827, 'comment_body': 'Done! used "conversation item list & extra interaction item list" teminology.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 0, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459961932, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 0, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962261, 'comment_body': 'I have moved it to the companion object of the suggested class `InteractionViewModelModule`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962423, 'comment_body': 'Done, renamed to `isDeviceLargeEnoughForSplitScreen`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962507, 'comment_body': 'Removed', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962570, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962691, 'comment_body': 'Done, renamed to `shouldCheckForSplittingInteraction`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 2, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459963133, 'comment_body': "I'll try to figure out how to simplify it. For now, I have pushed the other suggested changes.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 3, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 460008173, 'comment_body': 'I have tried. <!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Added the **initial files** required for Question/Exploration Player high-fi work
- Fixes #1525 

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1171 
- Fixes #1173 
- Fixes #1175 
- Fixes #1177 
- Mocks: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/grid

This PR implements the high-fi work for **Tablet Devices** and **Split Screen** for the following items
- [x] Content Item
- [x] Feedback Item
- [x] Submitted Item
- [x] Submitted Item List
- [x] Previous Responses Header
- [x] Text Input Interaction
- [x] Fraction Input Interaction
- [x] Number Input Interaction
- [x] Drag and Drop Interaction
- [x] Multiple Choice Interaction
- [x] Item Selection Interaction
- [x] Continue Button
- [x] Submit Button
- [x] Previous Button (active/ inactive)
- [x] Next Button
- [x] Replay Button
- [x] Return to Topic Button
- [x] Question ProgressBar in QuestionPlayer
- [x] AudioBar in ExplorationPlayer

## What was changed  
### StateRecyclerViewAssembler  
- Used the observable field `isSplitView` for all ViewModels
- Added `isExtraInteractionAnswerCorrect` that is used in the split-screen to center the correct answer of the user on the right
![screenshot-2020-07-27_13 30 57 567](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88538565-dda6bb80-d00f-11ea-9864-c5b597ff44ea.png)
### layout-land  
- Deleted all the `layout-land` files for the interactions because they didn't  exist before split-screen work
### Player sub-components  
- Updated the margins to follow the following rules
  - QuestionPlayer sub-components items are centered (`128` start and end margin in `portrait`) (`192` start and end margins in `landscape`)
  - ExplorationPlayer sub-components items follow the conversational view (`176` and `208` margins in `landscape`) (`112` and `144` margins in `portrait`)
### dimen.xml
- Added some values
### state_fragment
- Updated the margins of the `AudioBar` and `Congratulation` text
### question_fragment
- Updated the margins of the `QuestionProgressBar` and `Congratulation` text
## Screenshots

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1493
- Implemented the split-screen for the Question and Exploration Player
- Mocks: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/72484161-8707-438a-bf20-50f964216d76/
- `ImageClickInput` test cases issue #1512 
## Screenshots
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 17 09 576](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173192-76a99100-cc22-11ea-96d3-95365127ee84.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 17 28 166](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173210-7c9f7200-cc22-11ea-8e26-b7f7e9440f6a.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 18 10 713](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173227-83c68000-cc22-11ea-92ef-02d1ca91bded.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 18 46 641](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173254-8e811500-cc22-11ea-9afd-fb8b313e098e.png)
![screenshot-2020-07-22_13 19 27 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88173272-9476f600-cc22-11ea-953b-9ebe2bc51a15.png)

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 23, 22, 19, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459800617, 'comment_body': 'Should we be using directional terminology (left/right)? How should this split column work for RTL layouts? Perhaps instead, we have primary & secondary item lists, or conversation item list & extra interaction item list. What do you think?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 35, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459800798, 'comment_body': 'Is ``if (isSplitView.get()) {`` not sufficient?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 36, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801131, 'comment_body': 'Since the unit is in inches, the method name should compute that, e.g.: ``computeDeviceDiagonalSizeInches``', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 37, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801254, 'comment_body': "Perhaps instead: ``shouldSplitScreen``? I'm assuming it's always 'possible', just not always desirable.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 38, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801751, 'comment_body': 'Can we centrally define this property, instead? E.g. either as part of the service-level interaction module, or as part of the interaction view model module. We have two modules that define all things interactions, and we should incorporate this in one of those locations to make it easier to add & tweak interaction support in the future. I suggest adding this to the UI module for defining interaction view models, if possible: https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/blob/develop/app/src/main/java/org/oppia/app/player/state/itemviewmodel/InteractionViewModelModule.kt.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 40, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459801857, 'comment_body': "Or: ``isDeviceLargeEnoughForSplitScreen`` might be more explicitly clear. 'is splittable' almost reads like whether the device supports [split screen/multi-window](https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/ui/multi-window), which isn't the case here.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 40, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802152, 'comment_body': 'This provider is unnecessary--``SplitScreenManager`` is already injectable, so its type is automatically bound.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 42, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802226, 'comment_body': 'Perhaps: ``extra_interaction_recycler_view``?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 42, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802453, 'comment_body': '``shouldSplitInteractions`` might be clearer. Otherwise this is pretty vague for being in a centralized location like this. Also, isn't this more like "shouldCheckForSplittingInteraction" since the actual decision to do so depends on other factors (e.g. interaction ID & physical device size)?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 43, 38, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459802824, 'comment_body': 'Why do we need tablet & non-tablet landscape layouts for state & question players? It seems like standard landscape is also set up for split screen. Is this meant to fix margins & padding? If so, can we do that via dimens files rather than forking the whole layout?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 45, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459803149, 'comment_body': 'Is this correct? Do we want the previous button to be added to the right list?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 46, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459803501, 'comment_body': 'There seems to be a lot of logical forks here. Can we maybe split this into a few different helpers to make it a bit easier to understand what is being setup when for each case?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 48, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459803886, 'comment_body': 'Can this fit on one line? If so, prefer to. Also, I think we can simplify this slightly: ```kotlin if (playerFeatureSet.interactionSupport) { val interactionItemList = if (isSplitView) rightPendingItemList else leftPendingItemList addInteractionForPendingState(interactionItemList, interaction, hasPreviousState, gcsEntityId) } ```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 0, 49, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459922985, 'comment_body': 'I'd go with "conversation item list & extra interaction item list" This is a screenshot from an RTL emulator ![screenshot-2020-07-24_10 32 46 199](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88374074-636d0180-cd99-11ea-8150-e250267c2446.png) And using left/right for naming the lists isn't accurate, so I'll change them to " conversation item list & extra interaction item list"', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 8, 36, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459925717, 'comment_body': "It is complaining when I do it this way because `isSplitView.get()` is nullable (Boolean?) So I have done it this way. I'm not sure whether using `isSplitView.get()!!` will be suitable here or it may cause the app to crash.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 8, 42, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459927059, 'comment_body': 'You have different views then 😄 @rt4914 @BenHenning You can decide together what I should do. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 8, 45, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459937917, 'comment_body': '`shouldCheckForSplittingInteraction` is better in my opinion.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 8, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459941861, 'comment_body': "Because there will be some tablets that won't support the split-screen. For these devices, we have some mocks [here](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/ff2d65ea-38d0-4ce9-a28d-183a03e1b061/). >Is this meant to fix margins & padding? If so, can we do that via dimens files rather than forking the whole layout? Yes, this is meant to fix margins & padding. But I think creating different files for tablet devices will make them easier to develop than using a lot of values in `dimens.xml` for different margins - padding.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 15, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459944034, 'comment_body': "It isn't being added to the right list (`extraInteractionPendingItemList`) here, it is being added to the left one (`conversationPendingItemList`). ``` extraInteractionPendingItemList += SubmitButtonViewModel( canSubmitAnswer, /* hasPreviousButton= */ false, previousNavigationButtonListener, fragment as SubmitNavigationButtonListener ) if (hasPreviousButton) { conversationPendingItemList += PreviousButtonViewModel( previousNavigationButtonListener ) } ```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 20, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459953960, 'comment_body': '>Can this fit on one line? If so, prefer to. It will fail in lint checks (Exceeded max line length) >if (playerFeatureSet.interactionSupport) { val interactionItemList = if (isSplitView) rightPendingItemList else leftPendingItemList addInteractionForPendingState(interactionItemList, interaction, hasPreviousState, gcsEntityId) } Yes, this is better', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 9, 42, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459961827, 'comment_body': 'Done! used "conversation item list & extra interaction item list" teminology.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 0, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459961932, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 0, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962261, 'comment_body': 'I have moved it to the companion object of the suggested class `InteractionViewModelModule`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962423, 'comment_body': 'Done, renamed to `isDeviceLargeEnoughForSplitScreen`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962507, 'comment_body': 'Removed', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, 36, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962570, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 1, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459962691, 'comment_body': 'Done, renamed to `shouldCheckForSplittingInteraction`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 7, 24, 10, 2, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 459963133, 'comment_body': "I'll try to figure out how to simplify it. <!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Added the **initial files** required for Question/Exploration Player high-fi work
- Fixes #1525 

## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1171 
- Fixes #1173 
- Fixes #1175 
- Fixes #1177 
- Mocks: https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/grid

This PR implements the high-fi work for **Tablet Devices** and **Split Screen** for the following items
- [x] Content Item
- [x] Feedback Item
- [x] Submitted Item
- [x] Submitted Item List
- [x] Previous Responses Header
- [x] Text Input Interaction
- [x] Fraction Input Interaction
- [x] Number Input Interaction
- [x] Drag and Drop Interaction
- [x] Multiple Choice Interaction
- [x] Item Selection Interaction
- [x] Continue Button
- [x] Submit Button
- [x] Previous Button (active/ inactive)
- [x] Next Button
- [x] Replay Button
- [x] Return to Topic Button
- [x] Question ProgressBar in QuestionPlayer
- [x] AudioBar in ExplorationPlayer

## What was changed  
### StateRecyclerViewAssembler  
- Used the observable field `isSplitView` for all ViewModels
- Added `isExtraInteractionAnswerCorrect` that is used in the split-screen to center the correct answer of the user on the right
![screenshot-2020-07-27_13 30 57 567](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/88538565-dda6bb80-d00f-11ea-9864-c5b597ff44ea.png)
### layout-land  
- Deleted all the `layout-land` files for the interactions because they didn't  exist before split-screen work
### Player sub-components  
- Updated the margins to follow the following rules
  - QuestionPlayer sub-components items are centered (`128` start and end margin in `portrait`) (`192` start and end margins in `landscape`)
  - ExplorationPlayer sub-components items follow the conversational view (`176` and `208` margins in `landscape`) (`112` and `144` margins in `portrait`)
### dimen.xml
- Added some values
### state_fragment
- Updated the margins of the `AudioBar` and `Congratulation` text
### question_fragment
- Updated the margins of the `QuestionProgressBar` and `Congratulation` text
## Screenshots

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes part of #1539 
- Implemented animation for **Hints&Solution** 
- Mocks: [Hints](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/e5d3beb6-6f0a-47cf-bd40-4ef00ef5e53d/P-Hint-Part-1-of-4-) - [Solution](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/a0681c39-25b2-4fd1-9a27-66fc2b8eb49b/P-Hint-Part-3-of-4-)
- [Implementation doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UxwcQ3nVcq40SCOkLbtaawHvN0r1SX5yf4VZr6byTv0/edit?usp=sharing)

## Important Notes
- All items (hints - solution) already exist in RV and we are just controlling the visibility
- Each `item_view` contains a divider at the bottom
### some approaches
- Current approach - [design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UxwcQ3nVcq40SCOkLbtaawHvN0r1SX5yf4VZr6byTv0/edit?usp=sharing)
  - Issues: The code is very big and cannot be reused somewhere else because we have to manually move the bottom divider
- Solution 1: Item decorator instead of view for showing line
  - Issues: The reason why it doesn’t work, all the dividers are visible even if the hint itself is invisible
- Solution 2: Put the last divider outside of recyclerview, below the recyclerview itself in the fragment file
  - Issues: It won’t animate the last divider. Instead, it will jump.
- Solution 3: Use different `view_types` for the dividers
  - Still under discussion
  - Approach: We need to add 1 divider after each item (after each hint or solution) so that it will automatically animate by the recyclerview. Adding these dividers can be done using a `class` that will:
    1. Take the available list of hints and solution
    2. Insert 1 divider after each item
    3. Return the new list that contains both hints and dividers
  - This class is playing the role of the adapter in the **Adapter Pattern**
## Screenshots (outdated)
### 1024x768 Emulator
![screenshot-2020-06-29_17 20 53 32](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/86026659-013a0e80-ba30-11ea-970f-b1bf8afa5629.png)

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1195 
- Fixes #1197 
- Implemented high-fi UI for **AdministratrControls** for tablet for both landscapse and portrait mode
- Mocks: [land](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/ed5480b9-cee5-4b28-845f-f0bf5d965653/) - [port](https://xd.adobe.com/view/d405de00-a871-4f0f-73a0-f8acef30349b-a234/screen/f55f5e39-3889-4900-a22a-4f6e531a51ca/)
### Note
Most of the newly added xml files are the same as their `port` version. I did that because they have the correct margins.
## Screenshots
![screenshot-٢٠٢٠-٠٨-٢٦_٢٠ ٠٣ ٣٠ ١٨٧](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/91331490-1bdbfa00-e7cb-11ea-8d2d-54e94c617bdb.png)
![screenshot-٢٠٢٠-٠٨-٢٦_٢٠ ٠٣ ٤٢ ٥٥٤](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/91331529-25fdf880-e7cb-11ea-8b66-6b4ad7d58e81.png)
![screenshot-٢٠٢٠-٠٨-٢٦_٢٠ ٠٤ ٠١ ٠٣](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/91331521-24343500-e7cb-11ea-9b80-b03f430d8c4f.png)
![screenshot-٢٠٢٠-٠٨-٢٦_٢٠ ٠٣ ٥٦ ١٦٣](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8533363/91331525-25656200-e7cb-11ea-8d3a-7bfac1f96215.png)


## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [X] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.

pr_body:
<!--
  - Thanks for submitting code to Oppia! Please fill out the following as part of
  - your pull request so we can review your code more easily.
  -->

## Explanation
<!--
  - Explain what your PR does. If this PR fixes an existing bug, please include
  - "Fixes #bugnum:" in the explanation so that GitHub can auto-close the issue
  - when this PR is merged.
  -->
- Fixes #1752
- Added a class that takes a screenshot from the device/emulator and used it in a test case
## Steps to test
### Initial setup
- Currently, we have to add the `WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` permission in the top-level `AndroidManifest.xml` file in order to try the functionality of this PR. This should be solved after #1746 is solved.

Steps:
1. Go to `AndroidManifest.xml` and add the following permission
```
  <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE" />
```
2. Go to the test class `OnboardingActivityScreenshotTest` and add the following test rule
```
@get:Rule val permissionRule: GrantPermissionRule =
    GrantPermissionRule.grant(android.Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE)
```
3. Now you can test this PR, try the following actions
### Recording references
1. Run the test cases in the class `OnboardingActivityScreenshotTest`
2. Run the shell command
```
adb pull "/sdcard/oppiascreenshots/" {project_directory}/screenshots
```
3. You can observe the following change:
A new folder is created in the project files called `screenshots` in which you can find a file called `org.oppia.app.onboarding.OnboardingActivity.png`
### Updating references
1. Run the shell command
```
rm {project_directory}/screenshots/*.png
```
2. Run the test cases in the class `OnboardingActivityScreenshotTest`
3. Run the shell command
```
adb pull "/sdcard/oppiascreenshots/" {project_directory}/screenshots
```
## Checklist
<!-- Please tick the relevant boxes by putting an "x" in them. -->
- [x] The PR title starts with "Fix #bugnum: ", followed by a short, clear summary of the changes. (If this PR fixes part of an issue, prefix the title with "Fix part of #bugnum: ...".)
- [x] The PR explanation includes the words "Fixes #bugnum: ..." (or "Fixes part of #bugnum" if the PR only partially fixes an issue).
- [x] The PR follows the [style guide](https://github.com/oppia/oppia-android/wiki/Coding-style-guide).
- [x] The PR does not contain any unnecessary auto-generated code from Android Studio.
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that's **not** called "develop".
- [x] The PR is made from a branch that is up-to-date with "develop".
- [x] The PR's branch is based on "develop" and not on any other branch.
- [x] The PR is **assigned** to an appropriate reviewer in both the **Assignees** and the **Reviewers** sections.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 479686974, 'comment_body': "We shouldn't be shipping with this permission. It also won't work on newer devices since you need to explicitly request the permission.

With Bazel, we can stage the test-only builds to programmatically add this permission to avoid adding it to the top-level manifest. In Gradle I don't think we can do that. Given this, I suggest that you:
1) File an issue for conditionally setting up external storage permission via Bazel (for post-M3)
2) Remove this from this PR
3) Write up a document explaining how to run & setup the screenshot tests. One step in there will need to be adding this permission back.

(1) will block being able to run screenshot tests in CI.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 25, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687000, 'comment_body': "Don't we need to actually request the permission?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 26, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687070, 'comment_body': "This should be part of the testing module--we don't want this included in the production build of the app.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 27, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687141, 'comment_body': 'Can we use png instead? We should be using a lossless format to avoid artifacts triggering flakes when performing the screenshot diffing.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687174, 'comment_body': "Don't we only need a view to be passed in?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 28, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687199, 'comment_body': 'Perhaps return the image so that the testing infrastructure can do something with it?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 28, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687301, 'comment_body': 'Tests should end in ``Test``. Also, we should be testing that the screenshot is successfully taken for a given activity. Given that, I suggest naming this something like: ``OnboardingActivityScreenshotTest``', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 29, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479687527, 'comment_body': "Regarding API, you should think through how the end-to-end flow is going to work even if we aren't building the whole thing right now. For example, the flow might be:
1) Open activity via Espresso
2) Do some operations & wait for idle
3) Take a screenshot & save it to storage
4) Compare the image with one included in the assets bundled with the build (the test golden image)
5) Pass/fail the test based on whether the image matches
6) If the image fails, provide a way to pull the image from the device to update the local golden image

While I don't think you need to build 4-6 in this PR, we need to think through how that entire flow will work before building any components (otherwise we might just need to redo most of this in order for it to work in the pipeline above).", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 29, 20, 32, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781704, 'comment_body': 'Done, updated the description.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 12, 57, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781708, 'comment_body': 'Removed this check. The permission can be granted using
```
@get:Rule val permissionRule: GrantPermissionRule =
    GrantPermissionRule.grant(android.Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE)
```
but as you said, this should be done in Bazel', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781715, 'comment_body': 'Moved to the `testing` module', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781718, 'comment_body': 'Updated to export png files.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781723, 'comment_body': 'I have overloaded this function to receive a `View` object.  
I think we still need this one too because we can pass the `activity` directly instead of having to pass `activity.window.decorView.rootView`every time ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781733, 'comment_body': 'Done, returned the bitmap object.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781739, 'comment_body': 'Renamed to `OnboardingActivityScreenshotTest`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479781753, 'comment_body': 'Understood your point. But is there something that I need to change right now concerning the class I added?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 30, 15, 13, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479888521, 'comment_body': '@MohamedMedhat1998 Please mention the issue number in this comment.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 5, 0, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479888728, 'comment_body': 'Add a brief description at the top regarding what this file actually does? Like a Kdoc', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 5, 1, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 479889340, 'comment_body': 'Just a thought, can we somehow check if the file is saved/stored at correct location.

Issue #1746', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 11, 43, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480342540, 'comment_body': 'Nit, direct import:

`/** A test class that is used to take screenshots of the [ConceptCardFragmentTestActivity]. */`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 19, 21, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480343165, 'comment_body': 'Nit: space after `.`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 19, 21, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480357700, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 19, 41, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480357712, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 19, 41, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480357727, 'comment_body': 'Done', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 19, 41, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480365256, 'comment_body': "Yes, but I don't know the specifics because I haven't thought through the full e2e testing flow yet. In particular:
- I don't understand how the manager will be used to test individual classes
- I don't know how we will actually retrieve images for updating the goldens stored in the repository
- I don't know how diffing will work to have a test actually be able to pass/fail
- I don't yet see how this will be extensible for future features that we'll likely want to add (like masking specific regions)

We shouldn't be checking in code whose design isn't well understood since it's likely that we might need to redo it.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 19, 56, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480381155, 'comment_body': '>     * I don't understand how the manager will be used to test individual classes

The `ScreenshotManager` class is mainly used to capture screenshots. So, I think it can be used in two places:
1. When we want to record a golden screenshot at the beginning, so, for example, we'll have a class called `OnboardingActivityRecordTest` which will be responsible for **recording the golden screenshots**. The process of recording, in my opinion, will be as follows:
   - Run the test cases in the class `OnboardingActivityRecordTest` (**ScreenshotManager is involved**)
   - If the test passed, run the shell command: 
```adb pull "/sdcard/oppiascreenshots/" {project_directory}/screenshots```
   - After these steps, the golden images can be found in `{project_directory}/screenshots`
2. When we want to verify the tests, so, for example, we'll have a class called `OnboardingActivityVerifyTest` which will be responsible for **recording the new screenshots** to verify. The process of verifying, in my opinion, will be as follows:
   - Run the test cases in the class `OnboardingActivityVerifyTest` (**ScreenshotManager is involved**)
   - If the test passed, run the shell command (notice that we are exporting the screenshots to another directory):
```adb pull "/sdcard/oppiascreenshots/" {project_directory}/screenshots_to_test```
   - Run some `python` script that will take every screenshot from the second directory `screenshots_to_test` and compare it with its peer from the first (source) directory `screenshots`

Both of these tasks can be wrapped into two different bazel tasks I think.
>     * I don't know how we will actually retrieve images for updating the goldens stored in the repository

Updating the golden images can be done in the following steps:
1. Run the shell command
```rm {project_directory}/screenshots/*.png```
2. Run the test cases in the class `OnboardingActivityRecordTest` (**ScreenshotManager is involved**)
3. Run the shell command
```adb pull "/sdcard/oppiascreenshots/" {project_directory}/screenshots```

These steps can be wrapped into one bazel task command too I think.
>     * I don't know how diffing will work to have a test actually be able to pass/fail

Using the verify task that will be built using bazel as my suggestion above I suggest.
>     * I don't yet see how this will be extensible for future features that we'll likely want to add (like masking specific regions)

Maybe a new function that can take only some portion of the screen based on some constraints can be added.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 20, 29, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480381475, 'comment_body': '@BenHenning ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 31, 20, 29, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 480726836, 'comment_body': 'Thanks! This is a really good start, though we shouldn’t be designing systems in code reviews. Can this be moved to a short design document on which we can collaborate?

I think your PR is a viable proof of concept to show that this works, but we should work to come up with a system design that describes the full process before checking this in. There may be changes that come from that review process. For example, I think you can avoid having the two tests, this might better fit as a JUnit rule, and we might be able to make this work with Robolectric, too. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 9, 1, 3, 48, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'BenHenning', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 481049182, 'comment_body': '@BenHenning I have created [this doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LuETnZUIhvatNFxmToa0g2AMa61_aOElVm4ZMIPyyac/edit?usp=sharing) on screenshot-testing and how to use the `ScreenshotManager` class. PTAL and tell me if there is something that needs to change.  
@rt4914 PTAL and tell me what do you think too, please.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 9, 1, 10, 51, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'MohamedMedhat1998', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 481312596, 'comment_body': 'Reviewed and left comments.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2020, 9, 1, 17, 27, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'rt4914', 'type': 'User'}]
